alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 27 at 3:41PM PDT until March 29 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MONDAY TO 3 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6-8 with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...From 3 PM Monday to 3 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rough surf with mixed northwest swell and southerly wind waves.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
